document_data.mainbody: '''Azul''', also known as '''Calor''', was the [[Maztican]] god of rain and [[water]].
document_data.Appearance: Azul normally appeared as a meticulously clean, slightly plump young child. He always wore a [[gown]] of clean cotton.
document_data.History: Azul was the twin brother of [[Tezca]], the god of fire, and one of the children of [[Kukul]] and [[Maztica (goddess)|Maztica]]. He was believed to have given humans the gift of clean water for drinking and bathing. When his older brothers [[Qotal]] and [[Zaltec]] fought, he, along his his twin and his younger brother [[Plutoq]] sided with Zaltec.
document_data.Worship: Azul was a very important god for the Mazticans. His priests practiced human sacrifice, by drowning young children in a ritual pool. The priests also kept themselves clean in honor of their god's nature.
